metadata.Title: CVE-2021-21218 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Uninitialized data in PDFium in Google Chrome prior to 90.0.4430.72 allowed a remote attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information from process memory via a crafted PDF file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21218` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
